metadata.title: CVE-2013-6824 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Zabbix before 1.8.19rc1, 2.0 before 2.0.10rc1, and 2.2 before 2.2.1rc1allows remote Zabbix servers and proxies to execute arbitrary commands viaa newline in a flexible user parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
